title: How to Make Cream Cheese Sugar Cookies

steps.headline: Combine the sugar, butter and cream cheese in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat the ingredients with either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Set your mixer at medium speed and beat until the ingredients are light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the egg yolk and the extracts to the bowl and beat them for another 30 seconds.
Whisk together the flour and kosher salt in a separate bowl.
Add 1 cup of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat it at low speed until the dry ingredients are just incorporated.
Continue adding the dry ingredients in 1-cup increments and mixing until they are well combined.
Cover the mixing bowl that contains the dough with plastic wrap.
Place the dough into the refrigerator and chill it for 8 hours or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove 1/3 of the cookie dough from the refrigerator.
Place the rest of the dough back into the refrigerator to chill until you are ready to use it.
Sprinkle some flour on a work surface.
Cover a plate with additional flour and set the plate aside.
Set the dough on the floured work surface and roll the dough using a rolling pin into a rectangle until it is about 1/8” (3 mm) thick.
Dip a cookie cutter into the flour mixture and cut the dough into cookies starting with the top right corner.
Place the cookies on the baking sheet, spacing them about 1” (2.5 centimeters) apart.
Place any unused dough back into the refrigerator.
Brush the top of your cookies with the egg white using a pastry brush.
Sprinkle the cookies with colored sugar or candy sprinkles.
Bake the cookies for 7 to 10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper using a spatula and transfer them to wire racks to cool completely.
Take another 1/3 of the dough and roll it out.
Cut out the cookies, decorate them and continue baking them until you are finished.
Keep the dough that you are not using in the refrigerator
Once all the cookies are cooled, arrange them on a large serving plate and enjoy.
